title: chore(volo-grpc): use `TokioTimer` from the latest `hyper-util`
body:
## Motivation

Since `hyper-util` released 0.1.2, which added `TokioTimer`, `TokioTimer` in `volo-grpc` copied from `hyper-util` should be removed.

Fixes: #290

title: fix(volo-grpc): fix incorrect usage of `http_body::Body`
body: Fixes: #285

title: fix(volo-thrift): delete max_frame_size option
body: This option is not used now, we need to delete it to avoid misuse.

title: feat(volo-thrift): use fifo instead of filo for pool
fix(volo-grpc): add `TokioTimer` for server and client of `hyper`
body:
## Motivation

Both server and client of `hyper` need to set a timer, otherwise they will **panic** when timeout occurs.

But `hyper` does not provide an implementation of the trait `Timer`, and even if `hyper-util` does provide one, updates are not released in new versions.

## Solution

To solve this problem, this PR copied `TokioTimer` and `TokioSleep` from the latest repository of `hyper-util` and put them into `time.rs`.

`timer.rs` will be removed once the `hyper-util` 0.1.2 released, and `hyper_util::rt::TokioTimer` will be used directly.

Refer: https://github.com/hyperium/hyper-util/pull/73

title: feat(volo-http): support query and form
body:
This PR does the following:

1. Extractors `Query` and `Form` are supported
2. `size_hint` is implemented for `RespBody` and the response will use an exact `Content-Length` instead of using `Transfer-Encoding: chunked`
3. Using function `from_request` instead of `from` prevents complex type conversions and the code will be cleaner, e.g.,

```rust
// before
<Vec<u8> as FromRequest<S>>::from(cx, body, state)
// after
Vec::<u8>::from_request(cx, body, state)

// before
<Bytes as FromRequest<S>>::from(cx, body, state)
// after
Bytes::from_request(cx, body, state)
```

Note that the third one is a **breaking change**, method in `FromRequest` should be renamed from `from` to `from_request`.

title: chore(volo-http): re-export `http` and `hyper`
body:
## Motivation

To use `http` and `hyper` with the same version as `volo-http`, re-exporting and using them directly is a simple and useful method.

To use the same version of `http` and `hyper as `volo-http`, it is a simple and useful way to re-export them and use them directly.

title: feat: refactor rpcinfo to eliminate useless unwrap

labels.name: A-volo
labels.description: This issue concerns the main`volo` crate.

labels.name: A-volo-build
labels.description: This issue concerns the `volo-build` crate.

labels.name: A-volo-grpc
labels.description: This issue concerns the `volo-grpc` crate.

labels.name: A-volo-thrift
labels.description: The issue concerns the `volo-thrift` crate.

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: This is a PR that adds a new feature or fixes a bug.

body:
## Motivation

Previously, all the fields in `volo::context::RpcInfo` are Option, which may lead to many useless `unwrap` calls and this can lead to a lot of branch prediction.

## Solution

This PR removes the Option, and can slightly improve the performance.

Note this is a BREAKING CHANGE.

title: fix(volo-thrift): convert user handler error to INTERNAL_ERROR
body:
1. convient for error diagnose
2. add framework extension error as basic error

title: feat(volo-http): add `layer`, `layer_front` and shutdown hooks for http server
body:
## Motivation

Add `layer`, `layer_front` and shutdown hooks for http server.  These have been supported by `volo-thrift` and `volo-grpc`.

title: feat(volo-http): add middleware layers `from_fn` and `map_response`
body:
## Motivation

Middleware is important for microservices. In volo and its upstream frameworks, middleware exists in the form of layers, but developing a layer is complex.

This PR refers to `axum` and provide the functions of `from_fn` and `map_response`, they wrap a function into a layer and use it as a middleware.  Additionaly, extractors can also be used for functions wrapped by the middleware layer.

This PR references `axum` and provides the functions `from_fn` and `map_response`, which can wrap a function into a layer and use it as middleware. Additionally, extractors can also be used as arguments of the middleware function.

title: feat(volo-http): support `ConnectionInfo`
body:
## Motivation

This PR implemented `ConnectionInfo` with reference to `actix-web`.

title: feat(volo-http): support merging routers
body:
## Motivation

When developing a large project, users can create a `Router` in each mod and merge them in main mod. Merging routers is an important feature for this situation.

Additionally, this PR updates the http example with split routers, and more types support the `FromRequest` and `IntoResponse` traits.

title: chore(volo-http): add `Rejection` for traits in extract mod
body:
## Motivation

The previous `FromContext` returns `Result<Self, Infallible>` and the `FromRequest` returns `Result<Self, Response>`, which is not flexible.

## Solution

This PR adds a type `Rejection` for those traits and the `Rejection` should impl the `IntoResponse`.

With the `Rejection`, the `FromRequest` for `Json` can return an `JsonRejection` with more details.

title: chore(volo-http): move `FromRequest` from `request` to `extract`
body:
## Motivation

Since the trait `FromRequest` is used for extraction, it should be located in `extract.rs` instead of `request.rs`.

title: fix(volo-thrift): multiplex client erroneous data

labels.name: A-volo-thrift
labels.description: The issue concerns the `volo-thrift` crate.

labels.name: C-bug
labels.description: This is a bug-report. Bug-fix PRs use `C-enhancement` instead.

body:
Previously, when the client didn't poll the multiplex future to complete (such as timeout), may result in incomplete data written, and this may cause server panic because of erroneous data.

This pr fixed that by adding a flag indicates if the connection is dirty. This flag will be marked as dirty before calling write and resets after a successful write.

title: fix: enable the code index for volo gen code

labels.name: A-volo
labels.description: This issue concerns the main`volo` crate.

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: This is a PR that adds a new feature or fixes a bug.

body:
## Motivation
`include_service!` macro can't be recognized by rust-analyzer, so that the code generated by volo can't enable the code index provided by ra.

## Solution

Replace `include_service!` with `include!` to enable the code index provided by ra.

title: chore(volo-http): update service with wrapped `Request`, `Response` and `Infallible`
body:
## Motivation

The previous type in `Service` is `Request<Incoming>`, `Response<RespBody>` and `DynError`.  The first two are fixed types and their names are too long, and the last one is not useful.

This PR wraps `Request<Incoming>` and `Response<RespBody>` into 2 new types `Request` and `Response`, and replaces `DynError` with `Infallible`, which can be converted to `StatusCode::INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR`.

Also, this PR re-exports more types from `hyper` and `http`, and to prevent type conflicts, `volo-http` uses `hyper::http` instead of using `http` crate directly.

title: fix: normalize make_transport error to TransportError
body: For users who want to match the error code to do some specific logic.

An example is provided in [`examples/src/http/simple.rs`](examples/src/http/simple.rs).

title: feat(volo-cli): init for generated codes as a git repo
body:
## Motivation

The command `cargo new` can create a small project and initialize it as a repository using the specified version control software (`git` by default).

The `volo init` needs a same function and this PR does it.

## Solution

The implementation of this PR refers to the source code of `cargo`. After generating codes, the current directory will be initialized as a git repository if it is not in an existing git repository, or is in a git repository but conforms to its "gitignore" rules.

Reference: <https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/blob/0.74.0/src/cargo/util/vcs.rs>

title: Format generated codes and make err outputs readable for `volo-cli`
body:
## Motivation

The previous `volo-cli` will panic when the input idl file does not exist or cannot be accessed by the current user:

```
$ volo init volo-example idl/file-not-exist.thrift
thread 'main' panicked at /home/****/.cargo/registry/src/rsproxy.cn-0dccff568467c15b/pilota-build-0.9.0/src/parser/thrift/mod.rs:662:49:
normalize path failed: idl/file-not-exist.thrift
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
```

```
$ volo init volo-example idl/file-without-permission.thrift
thread 'main' panicked at /home/****/.cargo/registry/src/rsproxy.cn-0dccff568467c15b/pilota-build-0.9.0/src/parser/thrift/mod.rs:29:72:
called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Os { code: 13, kind: PermissionDenied, message: "Permission denied" }
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
```

Even if the `volo-cli` does not panic, the error message is output twice:

```
$ volo init volo-example idl/empty-file.thrift
cargo:rerun-if-changed=/home/****/****/volo-example/idl/empty-file.thrift
 ERROR volo > No service found.
Error: No service found.
```

Also, the templates that generate the codes have some empty lines, this PR also removes them and runs `cargo fmt --all` after generating codes.

## Solution

1. Check whether the idl files exist and handle errors before reading them,
2. Do not return `Result` in `main`, call `std::process::exit` directly
3. Run `cargo fmt --all` after generating codes

body:
An initial attempt to add TLS support for gRPC.

## Motivation

#6 

## Solution

Two new features flags are added `"rustls"` and `"native-tls"` so that user can choose the preferred TLS implementation in the community. A new client/server example that uses `"rustls"` is added to showcase the usage. 

Additionally, `Cargo.lock` is removed from the tracked files in git.

title: feat: support hot_restart
body:
<!--
Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/cloudwego/volo/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

## Motivation

Hot restart (also named `smooth process upgrade`) refers to the ability of a system or software to undergo upgrades or updates without disrupting the ongoing processes or operations. Supporting smooth process upgrade is essential for maintaining system availability, minimizing downtime, and providing a seamless user experience during the upgrade process.


<!--
Explain the context and why you're making that change. What is the problem
you're trying to solve? If a new feature is being added, describe the intended
use case that feature fulfills.
-->

## Solution

<!--
Summarize the solution and provide any necessary context needed to understand
the code change.
-->
The key to hot restart is how to enable two different processes to share the same TCP or UNIX-domain socket, especially when they are not parent-child processes. Fortunately, Linux (or rather UNIX) provides us with the necessary tool. We can use UNIX-domain sockets to pass file descriptors between applications, specifically utilizing the SCM_RIGHTS mechanism.

Our solution focuses on the following key points:

1. To utilize hot restart, you need to initialize the hot restart mechanism.
2. The process first attempts to connect to the parent_sock. If the connection fails, it means that the process is the original parent process. In this case, the process should bind the parent_sock and parent_handle, waiting for the child process to send a message.
3. If the child process successfully connects to the parent_sock, it duplicates the file descriptors using `dup_parent_listener_sock`.
4. Once all listener sockets are duplicated, the child process sends a terminate_parent request to the parent process.
5. The parent process receives the termination signal (term) and gracefully exits."

<!--

title: feat: new codegen
body:
# Motivation

migrate to new pilota codegen

# Solution

replace `TokenStream` with `String`, because `TokenStream` doesn't implement `Send` and `Sync`
